Description:
One of the few places in the world where children and adults can have fun is an amusement park. Even more if they have all the most exciting attractions, as is the case with the Disney park complexes located around the world.

Disney has been in charge of keeping most people entertained, not only with its movies or television series but also with its intriguing themes in each of its parks. That's why we've compiled a list of Disney parks around the world that, despite being under the same ownership, have a distinct local flavor.

Magic Kingdom Park is the fulfillment of all our childhood aspirations. Enjoy the rides, beautiful fireworks, musical parades, and meet Disney characters. Explore Adventureland, Frontierland, Liberty Square, Fantasyland, Tomorrowland, and Main Street, U.S.A. And the most beautiful thing is to see the fireworks over Cinderella's Castle.

This park has its doors open to the public since 1955. A curious fact is that it is the only one designed and built under the direct supervision of Walt Disney. Among its attractions are the famous Main Street USA, Tomorrowland, Fantasyland, Adventureland, New Orleans Square, Critter Country, Mickey's Toontown, Frontierland and Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, and of course the beautiful Sleeping Beauty Castle.

Disneyland Park, originally Euro Disneyland, opened its doors on April 12, 1992. This park features Main Street, U.S.A., Frontierland, Adventureland, Fantasyland and Discoveryland. In this park, the Sleeping Beauty Castle and Disney characters stand out.

On May 7, 2016, Shanghai Disneyland had started openings. This theme park combines Disney themes like Mickey Avenue, Gardens of Imagination, Fantasyland, Treasure Cove, Adventure Isle, Tomorrowland, Toy Story Land and of course its unique Enchanted Storybook Castle.

It was the first Disney park to be built outside the United States and it opened on April 15, 1983. The park has seven themed areas like the World Bazaar; Adventureland, Westernland, Fantasyland and Tomorrowland, Critter Country and Toontown. It features Cinderella's Castle just like the Magic Kingdom at Walt Disney World as its centerpiece.

Hong Kong Disneyland opened to visitors on September 12, 2005. The park consists of seven themed areas: Main Street, U.S.A., Fantasyland, Adventureland, Tomorrowland, Grizzly Gulch, Mystic Point, and Toy Story Land. A fun fact is that the theme park cast members speak Cantonese, English, and Mandarin. It has the Castle of Magical Dreams that pays tribute to all the Disney princesses.
